title: Credit Default Swap Data, Contagion and Financial Resilience
abstractText: The resilience of the UK financial system is of vital importance to UK society. This project examines questions around Financial Crises and particularly the information that can be gathered from CDS Markets about Financial Contagion. Lead by the interdisciplinary Oxford Man Institute, the award brings together Morrison and Wilson who will look at understanding interbank connectedness and its relation to financial stability and financial contagion and early stage independent researchers Schweikhard and Tsesmelidakis who propose to develop their novel structural model so that is capable of estimating the standalone credit quality of a firm with potential to provide insight for the design of market-based systemic risk taxes, bank capital regulation, and evaluate wider policy actions for their value in arresting the financial crises, and identifying the side effects associated with the "too big to fail" policy.
